content.question: A rectangular resistor of length <math alttext="10 centimeters " overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>10</mn><mtext> </mtext><mo>⁢</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.0em"></mspace><mtext>cm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and cross-sectional area <math alttext="8.0 centimeters squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>8.0</mn><mtext></mtext><msup><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.06em"></mspace><mtext>cm</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> is connected to a battery as shown above. The resistor draws a current density equal to <math alttext="2500 amps per meters squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>2500</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.06em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mtext>A </mtext></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>. If the resistivity of the resistor is <math alttext="0.048 ohms times meters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>0.048</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.06em"></mspace><mtext> </mtext><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.06em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, what is the potential difference of the battery?

choices.label: <math alttext="2 times 10 to the negative 6 volts" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></msup><mo>⁢</mo><mtext> </mtext><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
